<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Class for arbitrary precision integers.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="comment">/// APInt is a functional replacement for common case unsigned integer type like</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &quot;unsigned&quot;, &quot;unsigned long&quot; or &quot;uint64&#95;t&quot;, but also allows non-byte-width</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><Highlight kind="comment">/// integer sizes and large integer value types such as 3-bits, 15-bits, or more</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="comment">/// than 64-bits of precision. APInt provides a variety of arithmetic operators</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and methods to manipulate integer values of any bit-width. It supports both</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the typical integer arithmetic and comparison operations as well as bitwise</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="comment">/// manipulation.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The class has several invariants worth noting:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="comment">///   &#42; All bit, byte, and word positions are zero-based.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="comment">///   &#42; Once the bit width is set, it doesn&#39;t change except by the Truncate,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="comment">///     SignExtend, or ZeroExtend operations.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="comment">///   &#42; All binary operators must be on APInt instances of the same bit width.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="comment">///     Attempting to use these operators on instances with different bit</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="comment">///     widths will yield an assertion.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="comment">///   &#42; The value is stored canonically as an unsigned value. For operations</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="comment">///     where it makes a difference, there are both signed and unsigned variants</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="comment">///     of the operation. For example, sdiv and udiv. However, because the bit</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="comment">///     widths must be the same, operations such as Mul and Add produce the same</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="comment">///     results regardless of whether the values are interpreted as signed or</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="comment">///     not.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="comment">///   &#42; In general, the class tries to follow the style of computation that LLVM</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="comment">///     uses in its IR. This simplifies its use for LLVM.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="comment">///   &#42; APInt supports zero-bit-width values, but operations that require bits</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="comment">///     are not defined on it (e.g. you cannot ask for the sign of a zero-bit</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="comment">///     integer).  This means that operations like zero extension and logical</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="comment">///     shifts are defined, but sign extension and ashr is not.  Zero bit values</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="comment">///     compare and hash equal to themselves, and countLeadingZeros returns 0</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#91;&#91;nodiscard&#93;&#93; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a44d65323d90a63e5f572fe8f44db1154">APInt</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Byte size of a word.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a507f18d22ad9ce4dd96e8a664d577bdd"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">constexpr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a507f18d22ad9ce4dd96e8a664d577bdd">APINT&#95;WORD&#95;SIZE</a> = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">sizeof</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a5221357e5b7511cb0c90c94044ba35cf">WordType</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Bits in a word.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#aaf70a90533b469062634730e27f6577d"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">constexpr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#aaf70a90533b469062634730e27f6577d">APINT&#95;BITS&#95;PER&#95;WORD</a> = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a507f18d22ad9ce4dd96e8a664d577bdd">APINT&#95;WORD&#95;SIZE</a> &#42; CHAR&#95;BIT;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\name Constructors</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// @&#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Create a new APInt of numBits width, initialized as val.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If isSigned is true then val is treated as if it were a signed value</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// (i.e. as an int64&#95;t) and the appropriate sign extension to the bit width</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// will be done. Otherwise, no sign extension occurs (high order bits beyond</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the range of val are zero filled).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param numBits the bit width of the constructed APInt</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param val the initial value of the APInt</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param isSigned how to treat signedness of val</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param implicitTrunc allow implicit truncation of non-zero/sign bits of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                      val beyond the range of numBits</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a44d65323d90a63e5f572fe8f44db1154"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a44d65323d90a63e5f572fe8f44db1154">APInt</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> numBits, uint64&#95;t val, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/expandlargedivrem-cpp/#a49b2092a066cfbc24bc6925bdea9682a">isSigned</a> = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="normal">      : <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abee0df5f7f703bb4462aba260ba0a60f">BitWidth</a>(numBits) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Construct an APInt of numBits width, initialized as bigVal&#91;&#93;.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Note that bigVal.size() can be smaller or larger than the corresponding</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Construct an APInt from a string representation.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This constructor interprets the string \\p str in the given radix. The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// interpretation stops when the first character that is not suitable for the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// radix is encountered, or the end of the string. Acceptable radix values</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// are 2, 8, 10, 16, and 36 It is an error for the value implied by the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// string to require more bits than numBits.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Constructs an APInt value that has a contiguous range of bits set. The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// bits from loBit (inclusive) to hiBit (exclusive) will be set. All other</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// bits will be zero. For example, with parameters(32, 0, 16) you would get</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// 0x0000FFFF. Please call getBitsSetWithWrap if \\p loBit may be greater than</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\p hiBit.</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01503" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1503"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Get the minimum bit size for this signed APInt</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1504"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01505" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1505"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Computes the minimum bit width for this APInt while considering it to be a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01506" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1506"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// signed (and probably negative) value. If the value is not negative, this</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01507" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1507"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// function returns the same value as getActiveBits()+1. Otherwise, it</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1508"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// returns the smallest bit width that will retain the negative value. For</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1509"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// example, -1 can be written as 0b1 or 0xFFFFFFFFFF. 0b1 is shorter and so</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01510" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1510"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// for -1, this function will always return 1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1511" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a9f78d7e839322a6bfc0c665d29052242"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a9f78d7e839322a6bfc0c665d29052242">getSignificantBits</a>()</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01747" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1747"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01748" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1748"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\returns the nearest log base 2 of this APInt. Ties round up.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01749" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1749"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01750" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1750"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// NOTE: When we have a BitWidth of 1, we define:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01751" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1751"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01752" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1752"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   log2(0) = UINT32&#95;MAX</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01753" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1753"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   log2(1) = 0</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01754" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1754"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01755" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1755"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to get around any mathematical concerns resulting from</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01756" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1756"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// referencing 2 in a space where 2 does no exist.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01757" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1757"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> nearestLogBase2() </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01758" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1758"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01759" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1759"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\returns the log base 2 of this APInt if its an exact power of two, -1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01760" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1760"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// otherwise</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01761" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1761" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a6f1d5427c61a0f0159f6e85f41944c5c"><Highlight kind="normal">  int32&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a6f1d5427c61a0f0159f6e85f41944c5c">exactLogBase2</a>()</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01782" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1782"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// @&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01783" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1783"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\name Building-block Operations for APInt and APFloat</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01784" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1784"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// @&#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01785" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1785"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01786" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1786"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// These building block operations operate on a representation of arbitrary</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01787" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1787"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// precision, two&#39;s-complement, bignum integer values. They should be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01788" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1788"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// sufficient to implement APInt and APFloat bignum requirements. Inputs are</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01789" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1789"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// generally a pointer to the base of an array of integer parts, representing</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01790" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1790"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// an unsigned bignum, and a count of how many parts there are.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01837" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1837"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// DST += SRC &#42; MULTIPLIER + PART   if add is true</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01838" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1838"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// DST  = SRC &#42; MULTIPLIER + PART   if add is false</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01839" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1839"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01840" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1840"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Requires 0 &lt;= DSTPARTS &lt;= SRCPARTS + 1  If DST overlaps SRC they must</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01841" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1841"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// start at the same point, i.e. DST == SRC.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01842" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1842"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01843" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1843"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If DSTPARTS == SRC&#95;PARTS + 1 no overflow occurs and zero is returned.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01844" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1844"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Otherwise DST is filled with the least significant DSTPARTS parts of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01845" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1845"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// result, and if all of the omitted higher parts were zero return zero,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01846" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1846"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// otherwise overflow occurred and return one.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01862" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1862"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01863" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1863"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If RHS is zero LHS and REMAINDER are left unchanged, return one.</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2300" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/apintops/#ad2de5c5de0ed0d2032d6990969cb97b8"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">inline</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">float</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/apintops/#ad2de5c5de0ed0d2032d6990969cb97b8">RoundSignedAPIntToFloat</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp;APIVal) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2301"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> float(APIVal.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#aae8a216000ce553ed7e8d4c3a9bd1542">signedRoundToDouble</a>());</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2313"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/apintops/#a9f1937c6b659f3758dae8adca513fcd2">RoundDoubleToAPInt</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">double</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/spirv/spirvemitnonsemanticdi-cpp/#ac168ee0c965117536e841dd35a716d36ad67b0ee7230dcecb610254e4e5e589cd">Float</a>), width);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2314"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2315"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2316"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Return A unsign-divided by B, rounded by the given rounding mode.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2317"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> RoundingUDiv(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a3a0519ef55bfe3d07f8fb2eafb5cdbbd">APInt::Rounding</a> RM);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2318"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2319"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Return A sign-divided by B, rounded by the given rounding mode.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2320"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> RoundingSDiv(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a3a0519ef55bfe3d07f8fb2eafb5cdbbd">APInt::Rounding</a> RM);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2321"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2322"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Let q(n) = An^2 + Bn + C, and BW = bit width of the value range</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2323"><Highlight kind="comment">/// (e.g. 32 for i32).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2324"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This function finds the smallest number n, such that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2325"><Highlight kind="comment">/// (a) n &gt;= 0 and q(n) = 0, or</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2326"><Highlight kind="comment">/// (b) n &gt;= 1 and q(n-1) and q(n), when evaluated in the set of all</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2327"><Highlight kind="comment">///     integers, belong to two different intervals &#91;Rk, Rk+R),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2328"><Highlight kind="comment">///     where R = 2^BW, and k is an integer.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2329"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The idea here is to find when q(n) &quot;overflows&quot; 2^BW, while at the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2330"><Highlight kind="comment">/// same time &quot;allowing&quot; subtraction. In unsigned modulo arithmetic a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2331"><Highlight kind="comment">/// subtraction (treated as addition of negated numbers) would always</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2332"><Highlight kind="comment">/// count as an overflow, but here we want to allow values to decrease</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2333"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and increase as long as they are within the same interval.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2334"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Specifically, adding of two negative numbers should not cause an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2335"><Highlight kind="comment">/// overflow (as long as the magnitude does not exceed the bit width).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2336"><Highlight kind="comment">/// On the other hand, given a positive number, adding a negative</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2337"><Highlight kind="comment">/// number to it can give a negative result, which would cause the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2338"><Highlight kind="comment">/// value to go from &#91;-2^BW, 0) to &#91;0, 2^BW). In that sense, zero is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2339"><Highlight kind="comment">/// treated as a special case of an overflow.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2340"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2341"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This function returns std::nullopt if after finding k that minimizes the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2342"><Highlight kind="comment">/// positive solution to q(n) = kR, both solutions are contained between</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2343"><Highlight kind="comment">/// two consecutive integers.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2344"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2345"><Highlight kind="comment">/// There are cases where q(n) &gt; T, and q(n+1) &lt; T (assuming evaluation</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2346"><Highlight kind="comment">/// in arithmetic modulo 2^BW, and treating the values as signed) by the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2347"><Highlight kind="comment">/// virtue of &#42;signed&#42; overflow. This function will &#42;not&#42; find such an n,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2348"><Highlight kind="comment">/// however it may find a value of n satisfying the inequalities due to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2349"><Highlight kind="comment">/// an &#42;unsigned&#42; overflow (if the values are treated as unsigned).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2350"><Highlight kind="comment">/// To find a solution for a signed overflow, treat it as a problem of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2351"><Highlight kind="comment">/// finding an unsigned overflow with a range with of BW-1.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2352"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2353"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The returned value may have a different bit width from the input</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2354"><Highlight kind="comment">/// coefficients.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2355"><Highlight kind="normal">std::optional&lt;APInt&gt; SolveQuadraticEquationWrap(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cafd841a49aec1539bc88abc8ff9e170fb">C</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2356"><Highlight kind="normal">                                                </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> RangeWidth);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2357"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2358"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Compare two values, and if they are different, return the position of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2359"><Highlight kind="comment">/// most significant bit that is different in the values.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2360"><Highlight kind="normal">std::optional&lt;unsigned&gt; GetMostSignificantDifferentBit(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02361" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2361"><Highlight kind="normal">                                                       </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02362" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2362"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2363"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Splat/Merge neighboring bits to widen/narrow the bitmask represented</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2364"><Highlight kind="comment">/// by \\param A to \\param NewBitWidth bits.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2365"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02366" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2366"><Highlight kind="comment">/// MatchAnyBits: (Default)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02367" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2367"><Highlight kind="comment">/// e.g. ScaleBitMask(0b0101, 8) -&gt; 0b00110011</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02368" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2368"><Highlight kind="comment">/// e.g. ScaleBitMask(0b00011011, 4) -&gt; 0b0111</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02369" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2369"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02370" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2370"><Highlight kind="comment">/// MatchAllBits:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02371" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2371"><Highlight kind="comment">/// e.g. ScaleBitMask(0b0101, 8) -&gt; 0b00110011</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02372" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2372"><Highlight kind="comment">/// e.g. ScaleBitMask(0b00011011, 4) -&gt; 0b0001</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02373" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2373"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A.getBitwidth() or NewBitWidth must be a whole multiples of the other.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2374"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> ScaleBitMask(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NewBitWidth,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2375"><Highlight kind="normal">                   </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MatchAllBits = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2376"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// namespace APIntOps</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02377" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2377"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2378"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// See friend declaration above. This additional declaration is required in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02380" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2380"><Highlight kind="normal">hash&#95;code hash&#95;value(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> APInt &amp;Arg);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02389" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2389"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
